questions.question: What is the correct technique for executing a jump shot over a blocking ball?

answers.answer: Firm grip, mallet shaft at 45 degrees or less to vertical, downward strike on back of ball
Loose grip, horizontal mallet, forward strike
Medium grip, vertical mallet, lifting motion
Firm grip, horizontal mallet, scooping motion

correctTheory.title: Jump Shot Technique
correctTheory.author: John Riches and Wayne Davies
correctTheory.key_concepts: Advanced shots, mallet angle, strike technique
correctTheory.summary: A legal jump shot requires precise mallet angle and striking point, with the mallet shaft not exceeding 45 degrees from vertical to ensure a clean jump without damaging the court.

questions.citation: Croquet Secrets: The Collected Writings of John Riches (2009), Chapter: Advanced Shots
